prompt: La cloche en haut à droite n'est pas disponible, même lorsque l'extension "Notification d'alerte" est installée.
expected_answer: Assurez-vous que les notifications sont activées dans votre wiki. Vous pouvez les activer en définissant la propriété `notifications.enabled` dans `xwiki.properties` sur `true`.
ai_answer:
Sources: https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Notifications%20Application/ 
https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/XWikiSyntax/ 


Il semble qu'il y ait un problème avec le système de notifications dans XWiki qui empêche la notification du changement automatique des pages ou les événements liés à une page spécifique d'apparaitre même après l'installation de l'extension "Notification d'alerte". Voici quelques étapes pour résoudre le problème :

1. Assurez-vous que l'extension est bien installée et activée dans XWiki. Vérifiez les paramètres des notifications pour vous assurer qu'elle n'est pas désactivée par défaut ou bloquée dû à un filtre existant qui contredit le comportement attendu de la notification automatique lorsque l'on observe une page spécifique.
2. Si un filtre est en place, essayez de supprimer ou modifier pour permettre les notifications automatiques lors du suivi d'une page particulière. Vous pouvez également vérifier si le macro Notifications Auto Watch a été correctement configuré et s'il n'est pas bloqué par un filtre existant.
3. Si le problème persiste, consultez la documentation ou les forums de XWiki pour obtenir des conseils supplémentaires spécifiques à votre version du système d'exploitation et vérifier s'il y a eu des mises à jour récentes qui pourraient affecter le fonctionnement des notifications.
4. Si nécessaire, contacter le support technique de XWiki ou les développeurs fournissant l'extension "Notification d'alerte" peut être utile pour obtenir une assistance supplémentaire et résoudre tout problème lié à la compatibilité avec votre version spécifique.
5. En attendant, vérifiez régulièrement les mises à jour de XWiki ou l'extension "Notification d'alerte" qui pourraient corriger le problème.

sources.content:
### Watch and custom filters

Watching a location automatically create a custom notification filter, associated to that location, that targets all event types and all notification formats (alert and email).

XWiki 15.5+ Users are able to create their own custom notification filters, targeting only some specific events. So the watch buttons might be in an undecided state if there's an existing filter targeting the same location, but only some specific events, or some specific format. The idea is to inform the user that there's already a filter for this location and that using the watch buttons might impact the filter. 

If a filter is not targeting all event types and all formats, and is actually in contradiction with the filter that would be created by the watch button, then this filter will be automatically disabled when using the watch button. For example, if a user had a filter to ignore all mentions on a space, then watching that exact same space will automatically disable that filter. The user can always review their filters and enable them back.

![notification-watch-undecided.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/notification-watch-undecided.png?rev=1.1)



XWiki 16.3.0+ The custom filters are all displayed in a live data which can now be filtered and sorted out: 

![notification-custom-filters-livedata.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/notification-custom-filters-livedata.png?rev=1.1)  
![notification-custom-filters-livedata-filters.webm](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/notification-custom-filters-livedata-filters.webm?rev=1.1)

+ [Choosing the default frequency of notification emails](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Notifications%20Application/#HChoosingthedefaultfrequencyofnotificationemails)
	+ [Choosing the default level of details about the changes in the email](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Notifications%20Application/#HChoosingthedefaultlevelofdetailsaboutthechangesintheemail)
	+ [Choosing the default auto-watched mode](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Notifications%20Application/#HChoosingthedefaultauto-watchedmode)
	+ [Customizing the notification email template](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Notifications%20Application/#HCustomizingthenotificationemailtemplate)
	+ [Create global notification filters](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Notifications%20Application/#HCreateglobalnotificationfilters)
* [Developers](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Notifications%20Application/#HDevelopers)
	+ [Send notifications](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Notifications%20Application/#HSendnotifications)
	+ [Override default notification templates in wiki pages](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Notifications%20Application/#HOverridedefaultnotificationtemplatesinwikipages)
* [Prerequisites & Installation Instructions](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Notifications%20Application/#HPrerequisites26InstallationInstructions)
* [Dependencies](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Notifications%20Application/#HDependencies)

| [notifications](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/Notifications/Code/Macro/NotificationsMacro) | Notifications | Notifications | Display notifications about events happened on the wiki. | Current Wiki |
| [notificationsApplicationsPreferences](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/Notifications/Code/NotificationsApplicationsPreferencesMacro) | Notifications Applications Preferences | Notifications | Display the preferences of the current user about notification applications. | Current Wiki |
| [notificationsAutoWatchPreferences](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/Notifications/Code/NotificationsAutoWatchPreferencesMacro) | Notifications Auto Watch Preferences | Notifications | Display the preferences of the current user about auto watched pages. | Current Wiki |
| [notificationsCustomFiltersPreferences](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/Notifications/Code/NotificationsCustomFiltersPreferencesMacro) | Notifications Custom Filters Preferences | Notifications | Display the preferences of the given user about custom notification filters. | Current Wiki |
| [notificationsEmailPreferences](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/Notifications/Code/NotificationsEmailPreferencesMacro) | Notifications Email Preferences | Notifications | Display the preferences of the current user about notification emails. | Current Wiki |
| [notificationsFiltersPreferences](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/Notifications/Code/NotificationsFiltersPreferencesMacro) | Notifications Filters Preferences (deprecated) | Notifications | Display the preferences of the current user about notification filters.This macro is now deprecated in favor of Custom Notifications Filters Preferences or System Notifications Filters Preferences. | Current Wiki |

* [Description](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Notifications%20Application/#HDescription)
	+ [Group of notifications with details](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Notifications%20Application/#HGroupofnotificationswithdetails)
	+ [Get a notification RSS feed](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Notifications%20Application/#HGetanotificationRSSfeed)
	+ [Notifications Macro](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Notifications%20Application/#HNotificationsMacro)
* [Settings](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Notifications%20Application/#HSettings)
	+ [Filters](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Notifications%20Application/#HFilters)
		- [Hidden (technical) pages](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Notifications%20Application/#HHidden28technical29pages)
		- [Filter your own events](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Notifications%20Application/#HFilteryourownevents)
		- [Filter events that you have marked as read](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Notifications%20Application/#HFiltereventsthatyouhavemarkedasread)
		- [Filter minor events](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Notifications%20Application/#HFilterminorevents)
	+ [Watched Entities](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Notifications%20Application/#HWatchedEntities)
		- [Using it](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Notifications%20Application/#HUsingit)
		- [Auto Watch](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Notifications%20Application/#HAutoWatch)
		- [Follow a user](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Notifications%20Application/#HFollowauser)
		- [Default Watch Settings](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Notifications%20Application/#HDefaultWatchSettings)

# Description

This application contributes content in the Alert menu (contributed by the [Alerts Application](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Alerts%20Application/)) in the top bar, represented by a bell:

![Notifications.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/Notifications.png?rev=1.4)

You can find under this menu the notifications about some events happening on the wiki (a page has been modified, a new blog post has been posted, etc...).

The number of notifications is displayed on the top menu, just above the bell:

![notif1.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/notif1.png?rev=1.5)

If you have more than 20 unread notifications, you will not see the real count but this instead:

![MaxCounter.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/MaxCounter.png?rev=1.3)

When you open the menu, the content of the notifications is loaded:

![NotificationsLoading.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/NotificationsLoading.png?rev=1.3)

Then you can see the list of notifications:

[![notif2.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/notif2.png?rev=1.5)](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/notif2.png?rev=1.5)![NotificationsMacro.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/NotificationsMacro.png?rev=1.3)

If you click on the little button with the "check" icon, you mark the notification as "read". In the future, you will be able to select either you want to see only unread notifications or all of them.

When the notification is read, the button disappear and the background color changes:

## Get a notification RSS feed

You can get a RSS feed of the notifications occurring in your wiki. This feed can be accessed either through a link in your notification tray (or at the bottom of the notifications macro).

![NotificationTrayRSSLink.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/NotificationTrayRSSLink.png?rev=1.3)  
![NotificationsWithRSS.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/NotificationsWithRSS.png?rev=1.3)

## Notifications Macro

The [Notifications Macro is provided by its own application](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Notifications%20Macro/).

# Settings

On the notifications menu, you also have a link to go to the "settings" of the notifications.

![notif4.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/notif4.png?rev=1.8)

By default, users only get notifications when they are mentioned or when actions are performed on pages they created or updated. For receiving other notifications, you need to select which "types" of notifications you want to receive. When a page is created? When a blog post is published?

You can enable or disable all notification types that belong to a particular application by clicking on the bells associated to this application. If some types are enabled and other are disabled inside an application, the switch looks like the next screenshot, meaning that the application's notifications are partially enabled:

![NotifUndeterminate.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/NotifUndeterminate.png?rev=1.3)

Note that you only receive notifications that occur after you turn on the notifications types.
